item.title: HTTP Verb Testing
item.description: INTRODUCTION HTTP Verbs Every HTTP request starts with a single word. 99% of the time, it’s either GET or POST. If you’ve ever programmed a REST API, perhaps you’ve also used PUT and DELETE. Here’s the request your browser made when visiting my website: GET https://4wayhandshake.github.io/ HTTP/1.1 host: 4wayhandshake.github.io User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:109.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/115.0 Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/avif,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8 Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.5 DNT: 1 Connection: keep-alive Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1 Sec-Fetch-Dest: document Sec-Fetch-Mode: navigate Sec-Fetch-Site: none Sec-Fetch-User: ?
